messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/web.php`, I found that `PostCommentController::class, 'index'` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/posts/{post}/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/web.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `PostCommentController::class, 'index'`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the PostCommentController::index implementations (relative paths):

- app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php

Explanation:
- The web route in routes/web.php registers a resource route for posts.comments using PostCommentController from App\Http\Controllers with only the index method. This means the web-facing handler is implemented in app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php, and it defines an index method (signature: index(Post $post): View).
- There is also an API version of the PostCommentController under App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController.php, which similarly defines an index method (signature: index(Request $request, Post $post): ResourceCollection). This controller is used by API routes (e.g., routes/api.php) and is unrelated to the web route, but it still contains a PostCommentController::index implementation in a different namespace.
- Therefore, both files contain the relevant handler implementations for PostCommentController::index, one for web and one for API.
